agenda.description: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING COMMITTEE: Juvenile Justice & Family Issues TIME & DATE: 10:30 AM or upon final adjourn./recess or bill referral if permission granted Wednesday, April 17, 2019 PLACE: E2.012 CHAIR: Rep. Harold V. Dutton, Jr. HB 555 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to certain rights of the sole managing conservator of a child in relation to the child's passport. HB 556 Thompson, Senfronia Relating to the issuance of a protective order by default. HB 743 Davis, Yvonne Relating to the appointment and duties of an attorney ad litem for certain relatives in certain suits affecting the parent-child relationship. HB 2382 Dutton Relating to the classification of certain conduct by juveniles constituting the offense of evading detention. HB 2514 Martinez Relating to the appointment of an individual qualified to conduct a child custody evaluation. HB 2548 Leman Relating to the composition of the juvenile board of Grimes County. HB 3139 Bowers Relating to service of a notice of an application for a protective order. HB 3257 Raney | et al. Relating to the criminal consequences of using or exhibiting an imitation firearm. HB 3277 Wu Relating to the sealing of juvenile records. HB 3567 Farrar Relating to protective orders. HB 3689 White Relating to the office of the inspector general of the Texas Juvenile Justice Department. HB 4107 Wu Relating to establishing a restorative justice program for certain student conduct constituting a criminal offense that occurs on school property, on school transportation, or at school-sponsored or school-related activities. HB 4612 Shaheen Relating to the collecting of wages for child support payments. NOTICE OF ASSISTANCE AT PUBLIC MEETINGS Persons with disabilities who plan to attend this meeting and who may need assistance, such as a sign language interpreter, are requested to contact Stacey Nicchio at (512) 463-0850, 72 hours prior to the meeting so that appropriate arrangements can be made.
